Learn Another Language Bilingual people may be giving their brain an edge: Being bilingual your entire life seems to delay Alzheimer’s , research from Italy suggests. The researchers believe that switching between two languages exerts neuroprotective effects on your brain and can prevent degeneration of your neurons. 
Take Care Of Your Teeth Brush up and you might live longer . At least, that’s according to research published in the journal Periodontology 2000. People who lived to 100 or above had lower rates of tooth loss in their 60s and 70s than those who didn’t make it that long. 
Seek a Second Opinion? Foot or ankle injuries that are misdiagnosed can lead to a world of hurt later on, a review from The Journal of the American Osteopathic Association concludes. Common foot and ankle injuries, including snowboarder’s fracture and turf toe, can lead to arthritis and other problems down the line if they’re not diagnosed and treated appropriately. Your doctor may need to order additional tests or seek a second opinion from an orthopedic surgeon, the researchers say. 
Stop Popping Balloons Take this into account at the next birthday party you attend: The noise of a popping balloon is comparable to a high-powered shotgun going off by your ear, researchers from the University of Alberta discovered. This raises the question of how much everyday noises can contribute to gradual hearing loss over time, the researchers say.
